sen.j: 源 満末（みなもと の みつすえ、生没年不詳）は、平安時代後期の武将。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Mitsusue (dates of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
MINAMOTO no Mitsusue (dates of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
MINAMOTO no Mitsusue (dates of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
sen.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。
sen.e: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 嵯峨源氏の源融の孫の源是茂の子孫と称する。
sen.e: Referred himself as a descendant of MINAMOTO no Koreshige, the grandson of MINAMOTO no Toru from the Saga Genji.
Referred himself as a descendant of MINAMOTO no Koreshige: a grandson of MINAMOTO no Toru from the Saga Genji.
sen.cmt: 理解を助けるためコロンに変更、冠詞変更しました。
sen.e: Referred himself as a descendant of MINAMOTO no Koreshige: a grandson of MINAMOTO no Toru from the Saga Genji.
Son of MINAMOTO no Sueyuki.
A son of MINAMOTO no Sueyuki.
A son of MINAMOTO no Sueyuki.

sen.j: 嵯峨源氏も代が重なり、源満末の代になると都での栄達の途はない中下級貴族となった。
sen.e: When generations passed, at the time of MINAMOTO no Mitsusue, the Saga Genji had become middle or lower-ranking nobles who did not have any advancement in social status in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After generations passed, at the time of MINAMOTO no Mitsusue, the Saga Genji had become middle or lower-ranking nobles who did not have any further advancement in social status in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: whenをafterに変更、furtherを挿入しました。
sen.e: After generations passed, at the time of MINAMOTO no Mitsusue, the Saga Genji had become middle or lower-ranking nobles who did not have any further advancement in social status in Kyoto.

sen.j: 新天地を求めて地方に下ることが多くなる。
sen.e: Many of the people from the Saga Genji went to countryside seeking a new world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many of the people from the Saga Genji went to countryside seeking a new world.
Many of the people from the Saga Genji went to countryside seeking a new world.

sen.j: 満末もまた従五位下の位をもらい、仁安 (日本)3年(1168年)に九州の肥前国の天皇家直轄荘園の神埼荘(鳥羽院領神埼荘)に荘官(荘園管理官)として下向。
sen.e: Mitsusue was granted the position of Jugoinoge, and left the capital as a shokan (supervisor of the shoen (manor)) to Kanzaki-no-sho (Kanzaki-no-sho of the Tobain-ryo), a shoen directly controlled by the Imperial Family located in Hizen Province, in the Kyushu region in 1168.

Mitsusue was granted the position of Jugoinoge, and in 1168, left the capital as a shokan (supervisor of the shoen [manor]) for Kanzaki-no-sho (Kanzaki-no-sho of the Tobain-ryo), a shoen directly controlled by the Imperial Family located in Hizen Province in Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 括弧の種類変更、toをforに変更、冠詞削除、region削除、inの繰り返しを避けるため語順変更しました。
sen.e: Mitsusue was granted the position of Jugoinoge, and in 1168, left the capital as a shokan (supervisor of the shoen [manor]) for Kanzaki-no-sho (Kanzaki-no-sho of the Tobain-ryo), a shoen directly controlled by the Imperial Family located in Hizen Province in Kyushu.

sen.j: 神埼の豪族である松浦党山代氏の力を背景に武士として土着。
sen.e: Mitsusue settled down there as a samurai backed up by the power of the Yamashiro clan, Matsuura Party, who were the local ruling family of Kanzaki.
Mitsusue settled down there as a samurai backed up by the Yamashiro clan of Matsuura Party, who was the local ruling family in Kanzaki.
sen.cmt: by the power ofを削除、単数化、前置詞変更しました。
sen.e: Mitsusue settled down there as a samurai backed up by the Yamashiro clan of Matsuura Party, who was the local ruling family in Kanzaki.

sen.j: 神埼は日宋貿易に着目していた平忠盛以来、平家が知行していた。
sen.e: Kanzaki was under the enfeoffment by the Taira family since the time of TAIRA no Tadamori who was interested in the trade between Japan and the Sung Dynasty in China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kanzaki was under the enfeoffment by the Taira family since the time of TAIRA no Tadamori who was interested in the trade between Japan and the Sung Dynasty in China.
Kanzaki was under the enfeoffment by the Taira family since the time of TAIRA no Tadamori who was interested in the trade between Japan and the Sung Dynasty in China.

sen.j: 満末が下向した頃は平清盛の全盛期であったこともあり満末は山代氏や他の松浦党と同じく平家の傘下に置かれる。
sen.e: When Mitsusue went to Kanzaki, since it was TAIRA no Kiyomori's prime, Mitsusue was placed under the Taira family along with other Matsuura Party including the Yamashiro clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Mitsusue went to Kanzaki, since it was TAIRA no Kiyomori's prime, Mitsusue was placed under the Taira family along with other Matsuura Party including the Yamashiro clan.
When Mitsusue went to Kanzaki, since it was TAIRA no Kiyomori's prime, Mitsusue was placed under the Taira family along with other Matsuura Party including the Yamashiro clan.

sen.j: 子の源貞宗には壱岐国の賊徒追討の記録がある。
sen.e: There is a record of Mitsusue's son MINAMOTO no Sadamune having tracked and killed rebels in the Iki Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a record of Mitsusue's son MINAMOTO no Sadamune having tracked and killed rebels in Iki Province.
There is a record of Mitsusue's son MINAMOTO no Sadamune having tracked and killed rebels in Iki Province.

sen.j: 孫（あるいは子。貞宗の弟）の源久直が源平合戦の功により鎌倉幕府の鎮西御家人として筑後国三潴郡蒲池の地頭となり蒲池氏を氏とする。
sen.e: Mitsusue's grandson (or son, younger brother of Sadamune) MINAMOTO no Hisanao performed well at the Genpei War and became a jito (manager and lord of manor) of Kamachi, Mizuma County, Chikugo Province, as a Chinzei vassal of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal governmend headed by a shogun), and began to use the family name of the Kamachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Mitsusue's grandson (or son, younger brother of Sadamune) MINAMOTO no Hisanao performed well on the Genpei War and became a jito (manager and lord of manor) of Kamachi, Mizuma County, Chikugo Province, as a Chinzei vassal of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal governmend headed by a shogun), and began to use the family name of Kamachi.
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、前置詞変更しました。
sen.e: Mitsusue's grandson (or son, younger brother of Sadamune) MINAMOTO no Hisanao performed well on the Genpei War and became a jito (manager and lord of manor) of Kamachi, Mizuma County, Chikugo Province, as a Chinzei vassal of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal governmend headed by a shogun), and began to use the family name of Kamachi.
